item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, November 4, 2024 at 1:25 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Cheap Thrills, an album cover by Robert Crumb (2020) (70 points | 17 comments)
2. The history of Unix's ioctl and signal about window sizes (48 points | discuss)
3. Scientists glue two proteins together, driving cancer cells to self-destruct (437 points | 113 comments)
4. Limitations of Frame Pointer Unwinding (14 points | discuss)
5. Show HN: SplatGallery – A Community-Driven Gallery for Gaussian Splats (15 points | 3 comments)
6. Is the Q Source the Origin of the Gospels? (23 points | 2 comments)
7. The Saga of a Celebrated Scientist – and His Rodent Dystopia (15 points | 5 comments)
8. PropelAuth (YC W22) is hiring Fullstack and Rust engineers ( | hide)
9. An embarrassingly simple approach to recover unlearned knowledge for LLMs (168 points | 58 comments)
10. The Secret of Ramsey Numbers (12 points | 1 comment)
11. Project Sid: Many-agent simulations toward AI civilization (339 points | 101 comments)
12. Hertz-dev, the first open-source base model for conversational audio (192 points | 38 comments)
13. Scalable watermarking for identifying large language model outputs (17 points | 2 comments)
14. Touchscreens are out, and tactile controls are back (1033 points | 724 comments)
15. The heartbreak behind Dorothy Parker's wit (4 points | 1 comment)
16. A Hamiltonian Circuit for Rubik's Cube (77 points | 21 comments)
17. pg_flo – Stream, transform, and re-route PostgreSQL data in real-time (195 points | 36 comments)
18. A Missing IDE Feature (17 points | 3 comments)
19. I've had a change of heart regarding employee metrics (324 points | 186 comments)
20. Ritonavir Form III: A Coincidental Concurrent Discovery (18 points | 4 comments)
21. Programming languages that blew my mind (2023) (278 points | 158 comments)
22. The Submerged Nabataean Temple in Puteoli at Pozzuoli, Italy (54 points | 17 comments)
23. PacCam: Pac-Man controlled with your face (41 points | 9 comments)
24. Interview gone wrong (118 points | 157 comments)
25. Top discoveries about ancient people from DNA in 2023 (71 points | 5 comments)
26. gptel: a simple LLM client for Emacs (134 points | 28 comments)
27. New York Times Tech Workers Go on Strike (51 points | 50 comments)
28. It's a Palworld After All a Lawyer Explains Nintendo vs. Palworld [video] (20 points | 3 comments)
29. Missing open-source contributor presents a dilemma when accepting their PR (81 points | 54 comments)
30. Venvstacks: Virtual Environment Stacks for Python (111 points | 53 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, November 4, 2024 at 1:25 PM UTC
